intro: Notholaena ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty notholaena, is a perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its rhizomatous growth habit. The plant features lanceolate, serrated leaves that are often covered in a rusty-colored pubescence. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. Its spore-bearing structures, known as sori, are clustered on the undersides of the leaves.
